    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<UserResponseDTO>>
    getAll(int roleId)
    Get all users of the specified role.
    It is intended to only be used for tourists or guides, since administrators are not supposed to be known.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserResponseDTO>
    login(@Valid UserLoginDTO l)
    Attempts to log in a user with the specified credentials.
    Note that the UserLoginDTO.username field is trimmed and case-insensitive.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserResponseDTO>
    register(int roleId, @Valid UserRegisterDTO r)
    Attempts to register a new user with the specified credentials.
    It is intended to only be used for tourists or guides, since administrators are not supposed to be registered from outside the database.
    Note that the UserRegisterDTO.username field is trimmed and case-insensitive while UserRegisterDTO.firstName and UserRegisterDTO.lastName fields are trimmed only.

  • Method Details

    • getAll

      @GetMapping("/{roleId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<UserResponseDTO>> getAll(@PathVariable int roleId)
      Get all users of the specified role.
      It is intended to only be used for tourists or guides, since administrators are not supposed to be known.
      Parameters:
      roleId - the role of the users to get
      Returns:
      list of users of the specified role
      Throws:
      org.springframework.web.server.ResponseStatusException - HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST if the role is administrator

    • login

      @PostMapping("/login") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserResponseDTO> login(@RequestBody @Valid @Valid UserLoginDTO l)
      Attempts to log in a user with the specified credentials.
      Note that the UserLoginDTO.username field is trimmed and case-insensitive.
      Parameters:
      l - the credentials of the user to log in
      Returns:
      the logged user or
      Throws:
      org.springframework.web.server.ResponseStatusException - HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST if no user is found with the specified credentials

    • register

      @PostMapping("/{roleId}/register") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserResponseDTO> register(@PathVariable int roleId, @RequestBody @Valid @Valid UserRegisterDTO r)
      Attempts to register a new user with the specified credentials.
      It is intended to only be used for tourists or guides, since administrators are not supposed to be registered from outside the database.
      Note that the UserRegisterDTO.username field is trimmed and case-insensitive while UserRegisterDTO.firstName and UserRegisterDTO.lastName fields are trimmed only.
      Parameters:
      roleId - the role of the user to register
      r - the credentials and personal info of the user to register
      Returns:
      the registered user
      Throws:
      org.springframework.web.server.ResponseStatusException - HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST if the username is already taken or if attempting to register an administrator
